description.en: The course sets a framework for understanding urban planning by introducing the historical evolution of urban spatial structure and the complexity of challenges that urban planners face today. Through practical examples students become familiarized with modes of reasoning of urban planners and how to best today's complex urban challenges.
description.et: Kursuse käigus selgitatakse linnaplaneerimise arengut läbi linnade ajaloolise kujunemise ning tänapäeva linnaplaneerijate igapäevatöö väljakutseid. Kursusel tuuakse näiteid erinevatest olukordadest keerukates linnasüsteemides ning läbi näidete selgitatakse linnaplaneerijate töö etappe.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to explore underlying theories and approaches in planning theory for urban planners, as well as to introduce the profession and understand historical motivations for planning intervention.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on selgitada erinevaid planeerimisteooriaid ning tutvustada linnaplaneerija elukutset ja planeerimise ajaloolist tausta

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, the students have become acquainted with the:
2) planning challenges in complex metropolitan regions.
3) evolution of theories of urban planning.
4) modes of reasoning of urban planners.

independent_work.et: Three written assignments are required. The first assignment requires students to write a summary/synthesis comparing two urban planning documents. The second and third assignment consist of site visit reports for field-based excursions.

grade_preconditions.et:
1.	Completion of a written examination covering the lecture material and readings.
2.	Preparation of three written homework assignments.
3.	Attendance at class meetings and engaged learning, demonstrating reading preparation and participation in classroom discussions.

grade_evaluation.et:
Students must earn 65 out of 100 points to earn a passing grade.

50% Written examination
40% Two written assignments @ 20% each
10% Attendance and participation

Students who attend fewer than 67 percent of class meetings will not be allowed to complete the final examination and consequently not complete the course.

debt_elimination.et: Students are welcome to meet with the instructor to discuss preparing an alternate assignment (to earn partial credit) for an incomplete or unsubmitted assignment.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Assigned readings will rely heavily on: Hall, Peter.  2014 (updated edition).  Cities of Tomorrow.  Oxford, UK and Cambridge, Mass.: Blackwell Publishers.
resources.recommended_materials: Additional reading materials will be provided by the instructor at the beginning of the course.
